author: Dan H
comment: Very Useful!  Have it running on my SS Core Prime Phone/Fossil GEN3 Q Explorist watch.  Convenient to execute via Google Assist.  *(DEV... Would like screen controls to 'auto-hide' after 5 Secs so viewing is un-obstructed Please.  Also,  App needs to begin 180 degrees 'Upright' as its most common position for phone use)

author: Kaibosh
comment: I've used this numerous times to see behind things that have a narrow space. Image is crystal clear, ability to turn on led is great. The only issue that at initial launch, the rotation is always off - so I have to press the rotate button on my watch.
title: Great app - works really well

author: Franco Ochoa
comment: Works great on my Ticwatch E running Android Wear 2.0. The app is bare bones but does exactly what it says and does it well. Just launch the app from your watch and it automatically opens up a live feed on the watch display giving you a view of what your phone camera is focused on. I use it all the time for checking in hard-to-reach places at work.

author: Chris Forsyth
comment: Using with Nexus 6P and Sony Smartwatch 3. On Smartwatch have 'WiFi' app installed so always connected to WiFi even if Bluetooth available. Not sure if that helps refresh yet works well all over house with minimal lag. Good job! Only 2 suggestions, where available use WiFi rather than Bluetooth and  a frame rate so you can see it's actually updating (especially if your using it to keep eye on the kids in another room).
title: Great little app!

author: Steve Schnellbach
comment: I like the app.  There are a few things I'd like to request.  Ability to save all settings.  Save front and rear rotation settings.  Always need to rotate both cameras currently.  Also please save last used camera.  It always opens to front camera.  Thanks and well done app!
title: It's a nice app could use a few things

author: Patrick Gross
comment: Very awesome and fun, I feel like James Bond. My watch is new, I've been looking for a cool 3D app to show it off to people (to no avail) but this will definitely be my "go to" app when showing off my fancy spy watch. I'm also amazed that the camera actually loaded. The camera on my stupid phone only works 50% of the time (I have to restart to fix it) but it seems to work on my watch just fine with this app! Super cool!

author: Peter Barg
comment: very nice idea and works perfectly for the most part, but you need to drop frames. i tried it while also streaming music over bluetooth and the decreased bandwith caused a progressively increasing delay.  otherwise a great idea and simple and awesome implementation. love it. p.s.: also works while phone is locked. great.

author: Frank Delarocha
comment: Every time I try to load it on my s7 edge it never loads. It ends up getting stuck on the loading screen on my moto 360 2nd gen but never loads then crashes on my phone. It worked fine on my note 4. Needs to be fixed
title: S7 edge issues

author: J D PICKARD
comment: I was worried that it wouldn't work. Not all wear apps work on my 1st gen G Watch. I have to rotate the screen every time I use it, but very useful. At least it has the option to rotate.
title: Awesome!

author: A O
comment: Extremely slow,  major lag on Huawei /galaxy s6.  Waste of money. Would be cool if they can update with a fix.
title: USELESS!! DON'T BUY

author: Michael Becerra
comment: Nexus 6p/Huawei watch. Great app, brilliant. Takes a few minutes to show up on your watch. Well it did for mine. I rated this one star and right after I submitted it popped up on my watch.
title: What's the yellow meter/bar for ?

author: Geoff Swann
comment: First install didn't work, so uninstalled and one star. Gave it another go after seeing so many 5 star reviews and it works perfectly, really cool app!
title: Second times a charm

author: Mick McCarthy
comment: Tried this app twice on my Huawei watch. First time it locked up within seconds of first use. Refunded & uninstalled. Decided a few days later to try again & exactly the same. Locks up after about 5 secs of use. Can only get a refund once apparently so now stuck with a pile of shite app that does naff all. Keep your money & steer clear!
title: Pile of shite

author: Tommy L
comment: I don't usually rate apps but this app is extremely handy. I use it daily at work to monitor my service window and have never had any problems. Works flawlessly every time I fire it up. Great app. I would pay for it.

author: vinod kumar
comment: The one and only app which surprised me after downloading. One user mentioned it as a James bond watch. Yes it is. Now I am enjoying that. My watch is fossil marshal Q smoke. Android wear 2. I did not face any problem while installing.

author: DJ
comment: It's ok, but I can't use my camera app, and half the time it doesn't work. I wish I could get a refund on this.
title: Not the best

author: Matt
comment: I have toyed with cameras, old smart phones and countless other apps trying to find some sort of wifi remote surveillance system thats practical, cheap and WORKS. Rearview has exceeded my expectations in every way. Thank you developers!
title: Best app I've seen for smart watches yet!

author: Scotty H
comment: This is a great idea for an app. The playback is a bit choppy but I'm blaming that on the fact I have a Gen 1 moto 360. Otherwise this app works good.
title: Amazing

author: Michael Davis
comment: I've used it to find things behind the couch and also like that you can talk of the light and change the viewing orientation from the Moto 360 device
title: Useful and cool

author: Aaron Hewitt
comment: Very useful for getting a look at things you otherwise couldn't e.g. awkward bits of cars/plumbing/electrics. Ability to turn flash on remotely very useful. One missing feature - ability to capture images to the phone from the watch. Otherwise cool.
title: Very cool

author: Adam Doyle
comment: Works great with android wear OS. Very laggy when used on Tizen OS. Definitely a must have app would be nice if there were a capture feature though to record video take pic, but don't need of it makes it laggy.
title: Great app for wear

author: Leds4All SPRL
comment: You need to allow a change of resolution to have a faster reaction (0.9 m is enough)
title: Too much lagging

author: JpzNews
comment: This app is amazing. Can you please add audio support.  So that we could hear what's near our phone as well as see.
title: Can you add audio?

author: Christian A. Guerra
comment: Would be nice if u can toggle visibility of the overlay of the icons (OSD - on screen display) in camera view by tap and hold in the center, to get an unobstructed view.
title: Suggestion

author: john kelly
comment: Most of the time my phone will fit where my head won't. Great for looking inside machines or behind awkward access panels.
title: Really handy at work

author: Kieran Douglas
comment: Works really well when it chooses too but then just goes through fazes of not working. Currently in a faze in which it's choosing not to work. Paired with a Huawei watch.
title: Works Well Mostly

author: Farkas Gabor
comment: Data transmission (streaming) between phone and watch is quite good. Video is continuous enough, not stuttering as other apps do, similar to this one. However recording videos or at least taking photos would be elementary for an app like this. Without them this app is useless to me. (For not) maybe I'll re-purchase it if you add recording functions.

author: Sean Wolf
comment: Would be better if you could snap a picture. Artists that use themselves as references would get more benefit that way. Allow you to frame the shot and capture it.
title: Semi-useful

author: Randy Bolinger
comment: Have a Pixel and LG Urbane. Purchased the app and made 3 attempts to load but all failed.

author: John Hooper
comment: Pretty good. But would be even more useful to be able to capture images from the wear device (watch), using the android phone as the video/ camera source that is "looking behind"

author: Justin T
comment: Worked well on my Samsung watches, but is very laggy on my Android wear LG.
title: Laggy on LG urbane 2nd edit.

author: Tommy Ready
comment: I tried on my Note4 and Nexus 6p with my Marshall Q and it was slow and often unresponsive. Not worth .99, should be a free app for 8 yr olds to play with. Do not recommend wasting your time....
title: Very Laggy

author: Morry Zelcovitch
comment: An absolutely genius idea that works perfectly. If you added the functionality to take pics and video I would get Goggle to increase their star system to 10 and give them all to you :!)
title: S7 Edge + Moto 360 Second Gen = perfection!!!

comment: Works very well with Huawei p10 (Android 7.1) and Fossil Q Wander (wear 2)!  I'd also like to request the option for the app to make and save photos and videos.  That will make it super awesome!

author: Warren Shelton
comment: All this needs is an option to capture photo from Wear. Once added, this is a 5 star app for sure. HTC M8 + Moto 360
title: Great, but..

author: Stuart Wilcox
comment: I no longer need to rely on the other half when hitching up the caravan; and for that i would have paid a lot more.
title: Useful

author: Frank Layton
comment: This is a sweet app! It's so cool to be able to see through my phone's cameras. I can spy on my kids through the selfie camera unbeknownst to them while they play on my phone :-)
title: Awesome

author: Victor Acevedo
comment: Freezes after about 5 second Everytime. Good concept though
title: Galaxy edge plus and Moto 360

author: Bearcat Şándor
comment: I found a use for this in the first few minutes of ownership while building a computer. Yes,  it would be cool if it took video. I assume it works over Bluetooth and not wi-fi (which my watch can do), but I have not tested the range.
title: Very useful!

author: Tom Nieder
comment: This is great for reading serial numbers on small engines, appliances etc without standing on your head. Uses are endless
title: Great and useful app
